intro: Eriostemon ralstonii, commonly known as the Ralston's eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-green fruits. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
